context.description: Data Adapters
Hello here is our help for jasperserver
Here you can select a template for the new report, to define its base layout. Select the template by clicking on it, then hit the button "Next" to proceed.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.description: Here you can select the folder in the workspace where you want to put the report, and name for the report itself, then hit the button "Next" to proceed.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.description: Here you can define a datasource, the location from which the data is taken to fill the report. A datasource is composed by a data adapter, that is a connection to a resource (like and XML file or an SQL database), and eventually a query to identify fields that will be extracted from the resource.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.description: Here you can select which fields, discovered in the data adapter, will be added to the report or table. Fields that are not added now can be added later.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.description: Here you can choose which from the added fields will became groups.

topic.label: Designing a report with JasperSoft Studio

context.title: Report State View
context.description: Report state view

context.title: Outline View
context.description: Outline view

context.title: Properties View
context.description: Properties view

context.title: Report Templates Preview
context.description: Report Templates Preview

context.title: Repository View
context.description: Properties view

context.title: Report Templates (jrxml) Editor
context.description: Report Templates (jrxml) Editor

context.title: Style Templates Editor
context.description: Style Templates Editor

context.title: Data Adapter Editor
context.description: Data Adapter Editor

context.title: Report Preview Editor
context.description: Report Preview Editor

context.title: Report Run And Preview Editor
context.description: Report Run And Preview Editor

context.title: Font management
context.description: Font Management

context.title: Select a dataset
context.description: Here you need to specify a dataset, choosing if you want to create a new one or reuse another one created before.

context.title: Select name and type
context.description: Here you need to specify a name for the new dataset, and it must be unique since it is used as identifier. You also need to specify if the new dataset get the data from a data source (like a database or a XML file for example) or if it is empty and has no data in it.

context.title: Select the connection
context.description: Here you need to specify the connection used from the dataset to retrieve the data from the datasource. You can use an existing connection created for another datasource, or create a new one, choose the connection with an expression, or create and empty connection (this case it is equivalent to have an empty dataset.

topic.label: How to use a subreport with parameters

context.title: Select the layout
context.description: Here you can select which columns will be created for the table. Note that all the fields selected in the previous steps will be inserted into the Detail cell, so it is not present in this selection.

context.title: Select the chart type
context.description: Here you can select the type of chart you want to place into the report, select a template and hit Next.

context.title: Select the chart data
context.description: Here you can configure your chart. The dataset define the context of the report, or in other words the location of the data used to fill the chart. Reset type allow you to periodically reset the dataset. The increment when expressions allows you to add a flag to determine whether to add a record to the record set designed to feed the chart. You can provide one or more series using fields and variables.

context.title: Select location and name of the new syle template file
context.description: A style template is a container where you can define one or more styles and these styles can then be shared by many reports. In these step you can define location and name of the template file.

context.title: Select the styles template
context.description: Here you can select a styles template to include in your report. Doing this all the styles defined inside the template can be used inside the report.

context.title: Compose your expression
context.description: Here you can define an expression and use it inside your report. This powerfull expression editor allows the edit and composing an expression with a graphical interface that suggest the available fields, variables, function and their parameters.

topic.label: Expression Editor: what it is and how it works
Expression Editor: how to extend it and contribute your own functions

context.title: Change the page format
context.description: Here you can define the page format of the report. This includes margin, number of columns, paper format and page orientation. You can use also use many measure unit when you define one of this parameters.

context.title: Select the source of the subreport
context.description: Here you can define the source of the subreport. You can create a new report, using an existing one (you can directly select a report in the workspace or provide an expression to select it) or just create the subreport element in the report as palceholder.

topic.label: How to use a subreport with parameters

context.title: Select the parameters of the subreport
context.description: Here you can insert the parameter that will be passed to the subreport. The name of the parameter must be the same of the one used in the subreport and you can set the value of the parameters with an expression.

topic.label: How to use a subreport with parameters

context.title: Select the subreport file
context.description: Select the a report file from your workspace, and it will be used as subreport.

topic.label: How to use a subreport with parameters

context.title: Test property name help
context.description: This is the help of the property name.

topic.label: How to use a subreport with parameters

context.title: Select the type of barcode
context.description: Select the type of bar code you want insert in your report. Note that from here you can select only the type, instead the value can be set from the element properties when inserted.

context.title: Select the server and location
context.description: Select a JasperReport server and the location where the report will be uploaded. Select also a report unit id, and an optional name (can be equal to the id) and description. The report unit is the "folder" that will contains the report on the server and its resources.

topic.label: Publish a report into JasperReport Server

context.title: Select the resources to upload
context.description: Here you can select the resources used inside the report (like images) that will be uploaded with it in the report unit. Note that a report to be executed from JasperReport Server, must have all its resources uploaded.

topic.label: Publish a report into JasperReport Server

context.title: Select how to manage the data sources
context.description: Here you can define how to manage the datasources used by the report, since they can be needed to execute it. You can select to upload your use a datasource already on the server, try to upload your local one, or don't use any datasource.

topic.label: Publish a report into JasperReport Server

context.title: Wizard completed
context.description: You have successfully completed the wizard, hit Finish to return to the report.

context.title: Select the sample location
context.description: Here you can select the location in the workspace for the sample projects, by providing a name for the workspace fodler. Note that the name must be unique.

context.title: Select the return values
context.description: Here you can insert the value that will be returned by the subreport. The value must be assigned to a variable and have a calculation time, necessary to know when evaluate the parameter

topic.label: How to use a subreport with parameters
